description: The capital of Astyages (Istuvegü), captured by Cyrus the Great in 549 BC. The site served as a summer residence for both Persian and Parthian kings.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Hamadan. Hegmataneh was inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage site in July 2024.

names.details: Hemedān: It is also among the bilād-ı Cebel (the cities of the Jibāl region). It was originally built by Cemşīd (Jamshid), but as it fell into ruin over the passage of time, it was rebuilt during the era of the Islamic state. [translation]
